quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Michael, since it is your fifteenth anniversary at the company, I thought it might be appropriate to begin the festivities with a fifteen-minute round of applause.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I like it.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Followed by a fifteen minute moment of silence.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: [wearing a tuxedo] I don't know. Is it classy enough?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Jim! Enough with the classy, ok?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: I just feel like after fifteen years at this company, bravo by the way, that we should celebrate with a very classy event, a night to remember.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I think you're right. This party has to have all the excitement, drama and intrigue of my time here.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: And of course, classy.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: And classy, yeah.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Michael, you're just agreeing with him because he's wearing a tux. Don't you see what he's doing here?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Last week, Dwight sent out a memo about the dress code. So, this is me showing him that I'm taking it very seriously.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Oh, here's one:  a string quartet, playing classy-cal music. [Jim grimaces]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: [watches Jim grimace, copies him] You know, that's good but it's not classy. I-I need something classy like the opening of a car dealership.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: That's it. Or Mr. Peanut.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Mr. Peanut is not classy.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: He is.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: He is a regular peanut. He just happens to have a cane, a monocle and a top hat.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: That's what makes him classy.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Ok, how about this? An ice sculpture, shaped like you, covered in chocolate-covered strawberries.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Oh, Dwight, you're trying too hard, and that's just not classy. You see, the thing about classy is it's a state of mind.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Well, I'm sorry, I just don't know what classy is then.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Ok, well let's just try this one on for size. And I apologize because it's right off the top of my head:  an ice sculpture. Of you. Completely surrounded by a variety of chocolate-covered fruits.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Strawberries?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: That's inspired.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: I said that! [storms out, slams door behind him]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Not classy.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Not classy at all.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: De class�.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: French. Classy.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Hi, can I help you?

quotes.speaker: Charles
quotes.line: Yeah, I'm Charles Miner, here to see Michael Scott.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Sure. Just one second. Please have a seat.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: [on speakerphone] Yes?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Michael, there's a Charles Miner here to see you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Miner? I hardly know her!... Hello?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Yeah, are you coming out now?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Uh-huh. [comes out of office] Well, well, well, who have we here? Ah, it is Prince Charles Miner. [shakes Charles' hand] At your service. Everybody, this is Sir Charles Miner and he is the new VP for the Northeast region. So, just give it up for this big guy, right? Give it up. [leads round of applause] Here he is.

quotes.speaker: Charles
quotes.line: I-I was-

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Wow! Hold that thought. I want everybody to go into the break room. I have a little surprise for you. Go ahead. You too. Dwight, would you escort our guest in there? C'mon, here we go, don't be shy, don't be shy, you're one of us . [whispers] Dwight, stall him a little, I have to get the fish.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Really wish you would have told me the new boss was coming today.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: What? No, I didn't want to make everybody nervous.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Nope. I mean, I could have brought a change of clothes, or-

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: You look dynamite. What are you talking about? Very slick. Ok, get the fish.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Originally founded in 1866, Scranton quickly became one of Pennsylvania's largest anthracite coal-mining communities.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Surprise, there is nothing in here. The real surprise is in the conference room. Let's go! [swings arm above head for everyone to come, hits doorframe] Oh! God! Ok, come on, come on!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: We'll finish it up later, but essentially what we're talking about is...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Surprise! [unveils bagels sitting on table] As you can see, I turned the bagels from O's into C's, for Charles.

quotes.speaker: Charles
quotes.line: Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Took me all night.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: This is what you did last night?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I met this guy at corporate last week and we were just digging each other's vibe. I was totally grooving on him and vice-versa. And besides, the last two people to have his job were Jan and Ryan. The former was my lover, and the latter my best friend. So, who knows? I do. [in British cockney accent] It's gonna be mental! It's going to be mental.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: My god, he's like a black George Clooney.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Really? I don't see it. I mean, he's ok, he's not unattractive, it's. . .

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Hey, how you doing? Jim Halpert, sales. Just wanted to say, if you need anything, let me know.

quotes.speaker: Charles
quotes.line: Why are you wearing a tuxedo?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: I didn't think you'd notice. [laughs nervously] Uh, it's funny actually, there's another salesman out here, Dwight Schrute, and he sent out this memo, as he always does, and, uh, it was about professionalism in the workplace. Of course, he singled me out. So I just had to mess with him.

quotes.speaker: Charles
quotes.line: Uh.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Oh, you'd understand if you read the memo which I should probably get you, there's probably one in a drawer... uh. It was pretty crazy. But, uh, not more crazy than wearing a tux, at work, I grant you that... so, uh.

quotes.speaker: Charles
quotes.line: Your name is Jim?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Jim Halpert, yep. So, um, just going to let you get back to it... [being pulled away by Pam]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: He just had to wear his tux today.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: I thought it'd be funny.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Took him 40 minutes to get ready.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: All right, let me introduce you to some of the troops. Accounting, front and center. Come on up here. I'd like you to meet somebody. This is the accounting department.

quotes.speaker: Charles
quotes.line: Hey, I come from accounting, too.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Oh, nerd alert!

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Ni-

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: This is Oscar Martinez. He is Latino. And he just got out of a long-term relationship with a man, Gil, who broke his heart. But he didn't bring any of that into work, it did not affect his job performance whatsoever and I am very proud of him for that.

quotes.speaker: Charles
quotes.line: Hey, Oscar, it's good to meet you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: This little hell-raiser is Angela. She has slept with a bunch of different guys in the office. One over there, in the orange [points to Andy]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Hey-o!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: There you go! Where's the other?

quotes.speaker: Charles
quotes.line: You know, Michael, I don't need to know everyone's sexual history.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Well, perfect, because we have now arrived at Kevin and he has no sexual history.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Hey!

quotes.speaker: Charles
quotes.line: How about I just say hi to everyone at one time?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Good. Good, good, good. Everyone, please give it up for Charles Miner. [claps]

quotes.speaker: Charles
quotes.line: Thank you, Michael. Thank you for the C-shaped bagels.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Oh! Well...

quotes.speaker: Charles
quotes.line: That's great.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Above and beyond.

quotes.speaker: Charles
quotes.line: Hey, you know we're in tough times and we're not immune to this economy.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: That's true.

quotes.speaker: Charles
quotes.line: But the goal is to, you know, fight our way through this.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: [clears throat, raises his hand] Stanley Hudson. Are there gonna be layoffs?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: No. Absolutely not.

quotes.speaker: Charles
quotes.line: Uh, hold on, Michael, thank you. Uh, Stanley, you know, we can't make any promises, but we'll try everything in our power to avoid that.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: Do you have specifics?

quotes.speaker: Charles
quotes.line: Sp-Well, um, Michael should have filled you in last week.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Well, due to the economy, there is a lot of worry going around. I didn't want to worry people.

quotes.speaker: Charles
quotes.line: You didn't tell them.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Well, why don't-

quotes.speaker: Charles
quotes.line: Yeah, I will. What I told Michael last week-

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Charles is going to tell you.

quotes.speaker: Charles
quotes.line: Is that we are cutting three percent across the board, which means we will no longer be matching 401k contributions. All overtime requests will need to come through the corporate office.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: Fantastic.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Well, it's not official.

quotes.speaker: Charles
quotes.line: It is official. It is official. And actually, guys, I'm encouraging branches to consider a freeze on discretionary spending.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Such as salary, benefits, etc, etc. Insurance.

quotes.speaker: Charles
quotes.line: No, no, not salaries. Petty cash, supplies, and uh, you know, parties.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Well-

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: What about your party?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Ok, ok, you know what? I think this has been great. I think this gives us a lot to think about, doesn't it? Charles Miner, ladies and gentlemen. [starts round of applause] He has a long trip home. Thank you for coming in. We have to get back to work.

quotes.speaker: Charles
quotes.line: Michael, I'm going to stay for the day.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Oh no, no, no. You don't have to do that. I've got this covered. This was just a meet-and-greet.

quotes.speaker: Charles
quotes.line: No, it's a little bit more than that. I'm going to set up in here, ok?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I am thrilled that the new boss has taken such an active interest in all of the responsibilities that I'm supposed to have. Thrilled.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: [on speakerphone] David, it was my understanding that I was not going to be managed.

quotes.speaker: David
quotes.line: What gave you that idea?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: It was my understanding.

quotes.speaker: David
quotes.line: I see.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Listen, why don't we just leave that position vacant? Truth be told, I think I thrive under a lack of accountability.

quotes.speaker: David
quotes.line: Look, Michael, Charles is very qualified. Get to know him. I really think the two of you are going to make a great team.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: But the branch is still mine?

quotes.speaker: David
quotes.line: You're still the branch manager, yes, and if you need anything else at all, just let Charles know.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Ask him about the party.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Oh, right. David, are you coming to my fifteenth anniversary party?

quotes.speaker: David
quotes.line: I'll give it my best shot, Michael.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: No the other thing.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Oh, ok. If we hire Cirque de Soleil as salaried employees, will that help us with year-end tax stuff? [several seconds of silence]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: He hung up?

quotes.speaker: David
quotes.line: No.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I just got off the horn with David Wallace, and he said that you and I should try to get to know each other better. And I agree, so what I would like you to do is tell me something that you've never told anybody before.

quotes.speaker: Charles
quotes.line: No.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Come on. What's your wife's name? Where did you work before you came here?

quotes.speaker: Charles
quotes.line: Saticoy Steel.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Beautiful. See, African-Americans have such a rich history of unusual names.

quotes.speaker: Charles
quotes.line: No, I worked at a company called Saticoy Steel.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: You're not from paper?

quotes.speaker: Charles
quotes.line: No.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Does David know this?

quotes.speaker: Charles
quotes.line: Yeah, he knows. He just wants a good manager.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Well that, actually, is an excellent segue into really what is my only point-

quotes.speaker: Charles
quotes.line: And what is that?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: And that- I-I don't need to be managed, Charles. And if you want pick up some tips, observing here, and take them to the other branches, it's all good. But Jan would mostly come by when she was super horny, and Ryan would come by to visit his parents and do laundry, so... Are we clear?

quotes.speaker: Charles
quotes.line: That's not how I plan on doing things.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Ok, alright, well I'll just bounce that off David, see what comes back.

quotes.speaker: Charles
quotes.line: I'll tell David what he needs to know. Sorry. David wants it this way.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Whatever David wants.

quotes.speaker: Charles
quotes.line: Ok.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: [on phone] Michael Scott calling for David. Well, just tell him to call me ASAP as possible. Thanks.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Oh, Michael, come on, no. You have to charm 'em. [calls back on speakerphone]

quotes.speaker: Stephanie
quotes.line: David Wallace's office.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Hey there, gorgeous. How you doing today?

quotes.speaker: Stephanie
quotes.line: Good. Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: How's it hanging?

quotes.speaker: Stephanie
quotes.line: Alright. . .

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Good. Listen, my name is, uh, Michael... Scotch. And, uh, I just wanted to say that, uh, I've got David Wallace's son in the trunk of my car. If he doesn't get on this phone in 5 seconds-

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: No! You idiot! [hangs up] Idiot, idiot, idiot! What are you doing? God! Oh my god.  [redials]

quotes.speaker: Stephanie
quotes.line: David Wallace's office.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Hi Stephanie, it's Michael Scott again. I just spoke with Michael Scotch and the son's going to be returned, everything's fine.

quotes.speaker: Stephanie
quotes.line: Michael...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: And I really really need to talk to David.

quotes.speaker: Stephanie
quotes.line: Please hold.

quotes.speaker: Charles
quotes.line: [on cell phone] Charles Miner. Hello? Hello, who is this? Who is this?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I was never given a name. [hangs up, he and Dwight sigh in relief]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: [to delivery men] Uh, hi, can I help you? I don't think anyone here-

quotes.speaker: Charles
quotes.line: Oh, uh, Pam? Hey everyone, lunch is on me today.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: That is so unnecessary!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Are you kidding me with this? On the day that I bring in breakfast?

quotes.speaker: Charles
quotes.line: It's no big deal.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I wish you had told us sooner, because I was going to go to the vending machine and get an egg salad.

quotes.speaker: Charles
quotes.line: You still have that option. [Michael sighs]

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Thanks again, Charles.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Nobody thanked me.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Thanks, Charles.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: For breakfast. Except Charles. You say no more parties, and then you spend all of this money on lunch, I think it's a little hypercritical.

quotes.speaker: Charles
quotes.line: I do this for every branch I go to. If you do not like it, then I think there are some bagels left over from this morning.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: [on phone] Damn it, Stephanie, put me through to him. Is that him in the background? David? David! David, pick up the phone!

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: Should I seduce him?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: No. No one wants to see that. [both smile at David]

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Michael?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Yep.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: I just realized that I used the 2008 calendar to do the spreadsheets for January and February. I may need to come in this weekend to fix it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Do some overtime? You want to do some overtime this weekend? You know what, Kevin, I applaud your initiative. Yes. You may.

quotes.speaker: Charles
quotes.line: Uh, no, sorry, Michael. No, Kevin, right? We're going to need you to do that during office hours.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Ok.

quotes.speaker: Charles
quotes.line: Ok.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Kevin? This is my branch. You don't ask Charles. You ask me. I say, approved.

quotes.speaker: Charles
quotes.line: That's not the way it's gonna work.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Yes it is!

quotes.speaker: Charles
quotes.line: No, it is not.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: No, it is not.

quotes.speaker: Charles
quotes.line: Ok, so we're on the same page, great.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Ok, so we're on the same page, great.

quotes.speaker: Charles
quotes.line: Ok, Michael, what are you doing?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Ok, Michael, what are you doing?

quotes.speaker: Charles
quotes.line: No, seriously.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: No, seriously.

quotes.speaker: Charles
quotes.line: How old are you?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: How old are you?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Oh no.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: I can tell Michael's mood by which comedy routine he chooses to do, the more infantile, the more upset he is. And he just skipped the Ace Ventura talking butt thing. He never skips it. This is bad.

quotes.speaker: Charles
quotes.line: Five years old?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Five years old?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Duuudes, stop.

quotes.speaker: Employees
quotes.line: [as Michael continues imitating Charles] Not a good idea, Michael. Michael, stop. Stop doing that. Stop it. You're going to get all of us in trouble.

quotes.speaker: Charles
quotes.line: I will walk away.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I'm gonna walk away.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Stop doing that!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I'm kidding around, wow! Relax, everybody, it's just a joke. It's fine. Boy, so touchy. PPC, let's continue our morning meeting in the conference room.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: And then, out of that cake, pops another stripper holding a smaller cake. And then an even smaller stripper pops out of that one.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: What is that smaller stripper holding?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Cupcake. It's cupcakes and strippers all the way down.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Ok.

quotes.speaker: Charles
quotes.line: What exactly is the PPC?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: Oh, that's the Party Planning Committee. They spend hours planning parties.

quotes.speaker: Charles
quotes.line: Excuse me, guys. What's going on in here?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Party Planning Committee. Not your concern, Charles.

quotes.speaker: Charles
quotes.line: This doesn't seem like a good way to spend company time.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Really? Well then how would we come up with great ideas like Jim's? Go ahead.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: No, I would like to get back to work, actually, please.

quotes.speaker: Charles
quotes.line: Whatcha got, Jim?...  What is a two-way petting zoo?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: You pet the animals and they pet you back.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: It's a great idea. And we have a cake in the shape of a bale of hay.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: It's really just a regular shaped cake.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: But it's cool, and it's-

quotes.speaker: Charles
quotes.line: This isn't a good use of company time, Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Whoa. You're talking about my anniversary party, so. . .

quotes.speaker: Charles
quotes.line: Everyone, except for Michael, go back to your desks.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Yeah, why don't you do that?

quotes.speaker: Charles
quotes.line: [Dwight, Jim and Pam leave] Thank you very much.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Yeah, here we go. Ok.

quotes.speaker: Charles
quotes.line: Ok, Michael, I'm dissolving this committee.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: What?

quotes.speaker: Charles
quotes.line: Yeah, I mean, come on. This is a work place. It isn't designed for your vanity.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Newsflash:  I've been here for fifteen years. Headline:  You have been here one day. End of story. You have no right to cancel my fifteenth anniversary party. End of story. End of story. End of story!

quotes.speaker: Charles
quotes.line: I don't know if I have hurt your feelings or you do not disagree with my methods, but it is over.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Ok, no, no, no, no. No. You know what? I'm going to New York. And I am going to talk to David Wallace. [gets jacket] I'm going to tell him everything. And I'm sorry to say, you're screwed. And, you know what? You are gonna be through. And I'm sorry. I'm sorry to do that to you. Do you even know how paper is made? It's not like steel. You don't put it into a furnace. If you put paper into a furnace, you know what would happen? You'd ruin it. [pushes chair as he leaves]

quotes.speaker: Charles
quotes.line: [Jim knocks on door] Come in.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Charles
quotes.line: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Alright, Charles, I've gotta be honest. I think we really got off on the wrong foot here. And, truth be told, I'm a pretty smart guy, and, uh, a hard-worker.  And a great number two for the office.

quotes.speaker: Charles
quotes.line: Number two?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Second-in-command to Michael.

quotes.speaker: Charles
quotes.line: Oh, I didn't know that position existed.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Oh, that's because at first it was a made up position for Dwight, just to make him feel better, assistant to the regional manager. But then he lost that, and Michael gave it to me.

quotes.speaker: Charles
quotes.line: So you're the assistant to the regional manager?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Assistant regional manager, yeah.

quotes.speaker: Charles
quotes.line: Any responsibilities come with it?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: No, not exactly.

quotes.speaker: Charles
quotes.line: So you keep this made up position? It's important to you?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Alright, I will, um, I'm just gonna let you get back to that.

quotes.speaker: Charles
quotes.line: Yeah, would you, uh?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Yep. [shuts door behind him]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Hello, Stephanie. Ok, where is he? [looks into empty office]

quotes.speaker: David
quotes.line: [coming out from bathroom] Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: [points to bathroom door] So is this the meeting you've been in all day?

quotes.speaker: David
quotes.line: How did you get here, Michael?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I drove.

quotes.speaker: David
quotes.line: Ok.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Cancelled my fifteenth anniversary party. Just pulled the rug out from under me. And he said no figs. I've already bought em. And I don't have a place to store them. So, I feel like I've been sort of boned.

quotes.speaker: David
quotes.line: Michael. Listen-

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Do you talk to him about this? You've talked to him all day, obviously. Did you talk to him about this?

quotes.speaker: David
quotes.line: Well, I didn't know about the figs, specifically. . .

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Ok. Then I don't get it. It doesn't make any sense to me. Because I thought in the new system I was supposed to talk to Charles, and then Charles was supposed to talk to you, and that would dilute any need for me to ever talk to you again.

quotes.speaker: David
quotes.line: That's not exactly-

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Clearly that's what you wanted.

quotes.speaker: David
quotes.line: No.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Fifteen years I have been here. And I have sacrificed a lot.

quotes.speaker: David
quotes.line: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I've put having a family on hold.

quotes.speaker: David
quotes.line: We didn't ask you to do that.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: And I've never gone hang-gliding.  And I've never driven my car to the top of Mount Washington.

quotes.speaker: Charles
quotes.line: Ok. Nice meeting everyone. I'll see you in a couple of weeks.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Cool.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Excellent.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: It was very nice meeting you, Charles Miner.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: See ya. See ya. [Charles leaves] Bye!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: And for my next trick, I will make my career disappear.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: I could see our kids facing obstacles being half-Black and half-Indian, but it's so worth it, you guys.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: It's just me here.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: I am going to get him to buy me a prime rib tonight.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: I think he left.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: What?! Move! [pushes cameraman out of the way]

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: [Kelly runs to parking lot in the rain] Hello, Charles? Charles!

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: Hey! Is that his scarf?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: No! [Kelly chases Angela through parking lot]

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: [out of breath and wet] Charles and Kelly? Absolutely not. He is a sophisticated man. He does not need to go dumpster-diving for companionship, ok?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I don't understand that after fifteen years of service here, I have to get in the car and drive to New York in order to talk to you.  That doesn't seem right to me. That doesn't seem fair. And I think that I've earned more than that.

quotes.speaker: David
quotes.line: Yeah. You're right. Yes. I get it. I get it, Michael. Here's what I'm going to do-

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Ok.

quotes.speaker: David
quotes.line: We will move some money around, and I will personally see to it that you have your party, you have your figs. I will be in attendance. It's gonna be great. How's that?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: [gets up to shake David's hand] I quit.

quotes.speaker: David
quotes.line: What?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: You have no idea how high I can fly.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: I'm telling you, when corporate sends somebody, it is big trouble, or, really good news. And then sometimes it means business as usual.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.line: Ok, what do you think?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: Well, it's-

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Why are you asking him? I just told you why he's here.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.line: The real question here is who's this guy work for?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: Dunder Mifflin.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.line: Ah, it's all starting to make sense now.
